questions.question: 1. What happens to the average output voltage of a single-phase controlled bridge rectifier when the firing angle “α” increases?

explanations.a: Explanation 1: As the firing angle 'α' increases in a single-phase controlled bridge rectifier, the portion of the AC cycle during which the thyristors conduct decreases, leading to a decrease in the average output voltage.

questions.question: 2. Which parameter directly affects the RMS value of the output voltage in a single-phase controlled bridge rectifier with resistive load?

answers.a: Peak value of the output voltage

explanations.b: Explanation 2: The RMS value of the output voltage in a single-phase controlled bridge rectifier with a resistive load is directly affected by the firing angle of the thyristors.

questions.question: 3. The maximum output voltage of a single-phase controlled bridge rectifier occurs when:

answers.b: The firing angle (α)  is π/2 radians
answers.c: The firing angle (α)  is π radians
answers.d: The firing angle (α)  is π/3 radians

explanations.a: Explanation 1: The maximum output voltage of a single-phase controlled bridge rectifier occurs when the firing angle (α) is zero.

questions.question: 4. Which component is primarily used to reduce the output voltage ripple of a single-phase controlled bridge rectifier?

explanations.a: Explanation 1: A capacitor is primarily used to reduce the output voltage ripple in a single-phase controlled bridge rectifier by smoothing out fluctuations in the rectified voltage wavform.
